intro: Goetzea elegans, commonly known as the elegant goetzea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Goetzea elegans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
